value.title: POWERAPPS and POWER BI can do what?!? It's bananas!
value.excerpt: Patrick takes a look at how you can integrate PowerApps with Power BI to get a bananas experience. Updating the PowerApp does something special with the Power BI report.  Create a PowerApp: https://docs.microsoft.com/powerapps/maker/  PowerApps custom visual: https://docs.microsoft.com/powerapps/maker/canvas-apps/powerapps-custom-visual

value.title: Introducing CALCULATE in DAX
value.excerpt: This video introduces CALCULATE, the most powerful and complex function in DAX.  Article and download: https://sql.bi/749147?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Showing actuals and forecasts in the same chart with Power BI
value.excerpt: In budgeting reports, a common requirement is to show future sales forecast and actual sales volume on the same line chart. Learn how to achieve this goal using DAX. Article and download: https://sql.bi/73386?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX:

value.title: Get data with Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: How can you find, collect, and clean data from different sources? Power BI is a tool for making sense of your data. You will learn tricks to make data-gathering easier.

value.title: #41 Understanding relationships in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: You normally build relationships in Power BI (connect two tables together) so you can work with the data in both tables as if they were a single table.  In this video you will learn how to create relationships, understand what and how to use the advance options and troubleshoot the most common problems.

value.title: 2 ways to reduce your Power BI dataset size and speed up refresh
value.excerpt: Adam shows you two things to reduce your Power BI dataset size. These are both things he commonly sees with Power BI reports and could potentially save you a lot of space and improve refresh times along with report performance.  Data reduction techniques for import modeling: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/guidance/import-modeling-data-reduction

value.title: Create Buckets or Groups with Power Query in Power BI
value.excerpt: There are different ways you can create buckets or groups for your data in Power BI. value.title: Power BI slicers vs the filter pane (2021)
value.excerpt: What's the difference between Power BI slicers and the Filter pane? The filter panel can satisfy a majority of scenarios. There are a few that it can't. Which Power BI feature will you choose?  Slicer Panel: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xy9nmSQeUWg  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: How to Create Power BI TOP N Report (Power BI Top 10 / Top N Filter)
value.excerpt: Let me show you how you can create a Power BI TOP N Report , using a Top 10 or Top N Filter. As a bonus we will also compare this with another approach using the DAX TOPN Function. 👉 Download Power BI File in Video at https://web.learnpowerbi.com/download/  This is part of our complete TOP N playlist

value.title: Using the SELECTEDVALUE function in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn how the SELECTEDVALUE DAX function simplifies the syntax required in many scenarios where you need to read a single value selected in the filter context.  Article and download: https://sql.bi/53917?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Dynamic Power BI reports using Parameters
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows you how you can use a parameter, within a Power BI report, to dynamically change the data in a report. This uses M Functions within Power Query and a second source that has the key values to pull. Then using a gateway to enable refresh.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com

value.title: Month over Month Calculation in Power BI using DAX

value.title: Power BI Bookmarks, Selections and Toggles
